name: Find coordinates of vector origin
context:
Rearrange the code blocks to print the x-coordinate of the origin of the vector ``v``.
Vectors are objects that are initialized with a Point as origin, along with x and y deltas.
``new_vector = Vector(Point(x, y), delta_X, delta_Y)``
``v = Vector(Point(1,4), 5, 7)``

Misconception:
    - ObjectsMustBeNamed: Novices thinks object always needs to be named.
    - CannotChainAttributeToObjectInstantiation: Novices thinks that methods calls and attribute acces cannot be chained.
    - RightToLeftChaining: Novices thinks that accesses are invoked from left to right.

choices.fail_msg: There exists a better way to get the origin
A better method could be used to obtain the value of x.
